meanings.definition: To spend more money than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: She is outspending her friends on clothes.
meanings.sent2: The company is outspending its competitors on advertising.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his cat was outspending him on treats.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner was outspending his energy reserves.
meanings.sent5: The student was outspending his allowance on video games.

meanings.definition: The act of spending more money than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The outspending of the wealthy is evident in luxury purchases.
meanings.sent2: The outspending in the budget caused financial strain.
meanings.sent3: The outspending at the charity auction surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The outspending of resources led to scarcity.
meanings.sent5: The outspending of the government raised concerns about debt.
